## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard some updates about Verus and I'm not entirely sure what's going on. Can you tell me what the purpose of the multi-chain testnet was, and why was it reset?

**AI Assistant:**
The multi-chain testnet was being prepared for the integration with the Rinkeby testnet, and it was reset in preparation for this integration. It's an important step forward for Verus, and I'm happy to help clarify any other questions you might have!

**User:**
Speaking of updates, I heard there were some new ones available for Verus Desktop and CLI wallets. What kind of updates were made available, and who are they critical for?

**AI Assistant:**
Highly recommended non-mandatory updates were made available for Verus Desktop and CLI wallets. These updates are critical for notaries and pools, so if you're involved with those, you'll want to make sure to get the updates as soon as possible.

**User:**
I've also heard some buzz about Bluesky. What is Bluesky, and how is Verus involved with it?

**AI Assistant:**
Bluesky is an initiative from Twitter to create a decentralized social media platform. Verus lead developer Mike Toutonghi has been in conversation with the Bluesky team, explaining the benefits that Verus and VerusID can bring to their project. In fact, Verus has been selected to start a workgroup to integrate with OpenID. It's an exciting development, and we're looking forward to seeing how it unfolds!

**User:**
Finally, I heard that the Verus website is getting an overhaul. What changes can we expect from the new site?

**AI Assistant:**
The upcoming Verus website overhaul is expected to bring better, more concise messaging, easier-to-understand copywriting, more illustrations, and a clearer design, making it easier for people to digest and understand Verus. It's all part of our effort to make Verus more accessible and user-friendly, so stay tuned for the new site's launch!
What was the purpose of the multi-chain testnet, and why was it reset?
The multi-chain testnet was being prepared for the integration with the Rinkeby testnet, and it was reset in preparation for this integration.

Next to publishing the monthly recap on Medium, I will send the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll try to keep things short and to the point. So let’s get started with the very first monthly recap.
August 2021
Preparing Testnet for Ethereum Bridge
The multi-chain testnet has been reset. This in preperation for the bridge to the Rinkeby testnet. It has been said we are very close to this game-changing release.
Wallet Updates
Highly recommended non-mandatory Verus Desktop and CLI wallet updates have been made available. (Critical for notaries and pools). Download v0.7.4 here
Conversations with Mike & Bluesky
Bluesky is an initiative from Twitter to create a decentralized social media platform. Verus lead developer Mike Toutonghi had some very interesting posts in their Discord channel explaining the benefits that Verus and VerusID can bring to their project. Everyone in their Discord is still shell-shocked from the bombs that Mike dropped on them. Read a part of the messages here. Verus has been selected to start a workgroup to integrate with OpenID. The future will tell if it is something worthwhile. One big positive is that more people, and especially developers, will learn about Verus. You can read all the messages back in the Bluesky Discord, and please keep the shilling to yourself. We want to foster professional and productive environments.Giant Website Overhaul
We are close to finishing a giant website overhaul. Better, more concise messaging. Easier to understand copywriting. More illustrations. Clearer design. All-in-all easier to digest for all people. I personally can’t wait for it to be online. I believe it to be a great improvement that will definitely get more people more interested in Verus.
What kind of updates were made available for Verus Desktop and CLI wallets, and who are they critical for?
Highly recommended non-mandatory updates were made available for Verus Desktop and CLI wallets. These updates are critical for notaries and pools.
